result.execSummary:
The defendant Herminio Y Melendez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf'r Falsely Present NonDrug as Drug, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
Effective date:   06-25-2014      Initials:  AAC
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel.
  
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve  60 days at the House of Correction - straight time - with 17 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year.  Court recommends supervision with the Mental Health Unit. 

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent apprised.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Herminio Y Melendez in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Herminio Y Melendez in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State withdraws the Amended Information filed on 5-19-14.  Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Delivery of a Non-Controlled Substance as a Controlled Substance (Burn Law) 961.41(4)(bm) an unclassified misdemeanor.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court, defendant Herminio Y Melendez not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Bail argued by counsel.  Court sets bail at $100 cash TOT to Justice Point - no other monitoring conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Case set for return on warrant on 5-19-14 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44./ds
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

TAD evaluation has not been completed.  State revokes the deferred prosecution offer.

Defendant Herminio Y Melendez in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case may be resolved with a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant needs a TAD evaluation.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Herminio Y Melendez in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Herminio Y Melendez in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TARGET, 1501 Miller Park Way, West Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Herminio Y Melendez in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Herminio Y Melendez in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Defense motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause is heard, argued by the State and DENIED by the Court for the reasons as stated on the record.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Herminio Y Melendez
Current: 1212 S 24th St, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 03-10-2014)
Prior: 2013 West Vilter Lane, Milwaukee, WI 53204
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Herminio Y Melendez not in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2-28-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
